cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles ENE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast then northeast, paralleling the Southeast U.S. coast and aiming toward the North Carolina Outer Banks before accelerating seaward
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the Outer Banks, North Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: near-shore waters from east-central Florida northward past Georgia and South Carolina toward coastal North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Breezy to windy conditions Sunday with occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible as the storm’s western fringe passes offshore; sustained tropical-storm-force winds unlikely at the port itself.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Savannah due to the storm’s offshore track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to briefly moderate rain bands Sunday; totals generally under 1 inch.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells, elevated surf and dangerous rip currents along the Georgia barrier islands could hamper pilot transfers and small-craft movements at the harbor entrance.
